Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit where it pleases - "waiting my turn" -, and the Dutch continue to challenge this deeply ingrained U.S. travel ethic by insisting on demanding respect and compliance,

That this "U.S. Sense of Entitlement" has its source in colonialism and

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Polish director Agnieszka Holland’s style.
Holland initially appears to be positioning this movie as an attack against British colonialism. Helen (Charlotte Rampling), Parker (John Lynch) and Tobias (Ioan Gruffudd) take control of New Zealand and milk the local population dry.
